text: Hi , anyone having trouble with the design manager ?I can't duplicate a group.Thanks.

In terms of number of links/columns, I think 4 menus with 5 links each is plenty - generally speaking (general, because it really depends on site, but you can’t predict that if you’re making a template for the marketplace). Especially if each of those columns also have a header to indicate what the column links are, like “Resources,” “Products,” etc. I don’t think footers should be massive in terms of links. <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>, for example, is a massive site but has a setup like you describe for the footer.
If you’re looking for more concrete, research-based guidance, I’d highly recommend searching the articles at <http://nngroup.com|nngroup.com>. Tons of great info there.

Yeah sorry, i meant more in terms of the setup experience in Design Manager. With the most flexible solution (which would allow the user to easily delete menus/resize the amount of space they take up interactively) they would need to setup a menu per column. I was concerned this would pollute/crowd the Menu section in the site settings. However, maybe this is something I shouldn’t worry about!
am getting a little funk in the design manager when moving or deleting a module in a flexible column
did you reformat your hard drive <@UD53A9UUR>?
this looks like the page editor so i will need a bit more context
yeah, is the page editor.  happened on two portals.
if you rearrange items in that flex column, it doesnt appear as though they had moved and if you remove one of them, only the icon remains.  a refresh of page remedies
